alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Northern Tangipahoa; Southern Livingston; St. Helena (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 2:09PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern St. Helena, northeastern Livingston and west central Tangipahoa Parishes through 300 PM CDT... At 208 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Albany, or 12 miles west of Hammond, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Amite, Amite City, Livingston, Independence, Roseland, Albany, Montpelier and Killian. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 21 and 35. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 38 and 50. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Heavy rain will also result in significantly reduced visibility on area roadways including portions of I-12 and I-55. Motorists should slow down an be prepared for rapid changes in visibility if driving through the area.

area.areaDesc: Central Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Northern Tangipahoa; Southern Livingston; St. Helena
